   37:          end_per_testcase/2

   78: %% Apply export

   80:          monitor_nodes_test/3,
   81:          payload_test/3,

  100: 
  101: -define(DEFAULT_TIMETRAP_SECS, 240).
  102: -define(AWAIT_SSL_NODE_UP_TIMEOUT, 30000).
  103: 
  104: -import(ssl_dist_test_lib,
  105:         [tstsrvr_format/2, send_to_tstcntrl/1,
  106:          apply_on_ssl_node/4, apply_on_ssl_node/2,
  107:          stop_ssl_node/1]).
  108: 
  109: start_ssl_node_name(Name, Args) ->
  110:     Pa = filename:dirname(code:which(?MODULE)),
  111:     ssl_dist_test_lib:start_ssl_node(Name, "-pa " ++ Pa ++ " " ++ Args).
  112: 
  113: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  114: %% Common Test interface functions -----------------------------------
  115: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  116: all() ->
  117:     [basic,
  118:      embedded,
  119:      ktls_encrypt_decrypt,
  120:      ktls_verify,
  121:      monitor_nodes,
  122:      payload,
  123:      dist_port_overload,
  124:      plain_options,
  125:      plain_verify_options,
  126:      nodelay_option,
  127:      listen_port_options,
  128:      listen_options,
  129:      connect_options,
  130:      net_ticker_spawn_options,
  131:      use_interface,
  132:      verify_fun_fail,
  133:      verify_fun_pass,
  134:      epmd_module
  135:     ].
  136: 
  137: init_per_suite(Config0) ->
  138:     _ = end_per_suite(Config0),
  139:     try crypto:start() of
  140: 	ok ->
  141: 	    %% Currently no ct function available for is_cover!
  142: 	    case test_server:is_cover() of
  143: 		false ->
  144: 		    Config = add_ssl_opts_config(Config0),
  145: 		    setup_certs(Config),
  146: 		    Config;
  147: 		true ->
  148: 		    {skip, "Can not be covered"}
  149: 	    end
  150:     catch _:_ ->
  151: 	    {skip, "Crypto did not start"}
  152:     end.
  153: 
  154: end_per_suite(_Config) ->
  155:     application:stop(crypto).
  156: 
  157: 
  158: init_per_testcase(Case, Config) ->
  159:     try init_per_tc(Case, Config)
  160:     catch
  161:         Class : Reason : Stacktrace ->
  162:             {fail, {Class, Reason, Stacktrace}}
  163:     end.
  164: 
  165: init_per_tc(embedded, Config) ->
  166:     LibDir = code:lib_dir(),
  167:     case
  168:         lists:all(
  169:           fun ({App,_,VSN}) ->
  170:                   filelib:is_dir(
  171:                     filename:join(
  172:                       LibDir, atom_to_list(App)++"-"++VSN))
  173:           end, application_controller:which_applications())
  174:     of
  175:         false ->
  176:             {skip, "Must be run from a real Erlang installation"};
  177:         true ->
  178:             Config
  179:     end;
  180: init_per_tc(Case, Config)
  181:   when Case =:= ktls_verify, is_list(Config) ->
  182:     case ktls_encrypt_decrypt(false) of
  183:         ok ->
  184:             common_init(Case, Config);
  185:         Skip ->
  186:             Skip
  187:     end;
  188: %%
  189: init_per_tc(Case, Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  190:     common_init(Case, Config).
  191: 
  192: common_init(Case, Config) ->
  193:     ct:timetrap({seconds, ?DEFAULT_TIMETRAP_SECS}),
  194:     [{testcase, Case}|Config].
  195: 
  196: end_per_testcase(_, _Config) ->
  197:     ok.
  198: 
  199: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  200: %% Test Cases --------------------------------------------------------
  201: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  202: 
  203: basic() ->
  204:     [{doc,"Test that two nodes can connect via ssl distribution"}].
  205: basic(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  206:     gen_dist_test(basic_test, Config).
  207: 
  208: embedded() ->
  209:     [{doc,"Test that two nodes can connect via ssl distribution in embedded mode"}].
  210: embedded(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  211:     ReleaseDir = filename:join(proplists:get_value(priv_dir,Config), "embedded"),
  212:     EbinDir = filename:join(ReleaseDir,"ebin/"),
  213: 
  214:     %% Create an application for the test modules
  215:     Modules = [ssl_dist_test_lib, ?MODULE],
  216:     App = {application, tls_test,
  217:            [{description, "Erlang/OTP SSL test application"},
  218:             {vsn, "1.0"},
  219:             {modules, Modules},
  220:             {registered,[]},
  221:             {applications, [kernel, stdlib]}]},
  222:     ok = filelib:ensure_path(EbinDir),
  223:     [{ok,_} = file:copy(code:which(Mod), filename:join(EbinDir, atom_to_list(Mod)++".beam"))
  224:      || Mod <- Modules],
  225:     ok = file:write_file(filename:join(EbinDir,"tls_test.app"),
  226:                          io_lib:format("~p.",[App])),
  227: 
  228:     %% Create a release that we can boot from
  229:     Rel = {release, {"tls","1.0"}, {erts, get_app_vsn(erts)},
  230:            [{tls_test, "1.0"},
  231:             {kernel, get_app_vsn(kernel)},
  232:             {stdlib, get_app_vsn(stdlib)},
  233:             {public_key, get_app_vsn(public_key)},
  234:             {asn1, get_app_vsn(asn1)},
  235:             {sasl, get_app_vsn(sasl)},
  236:             {crypto, get_app_vsn(crypto)},
  237:             {ssl, get_app_vsn(ssl)}]},
  238:     TlsRel = filename:join(ReleaseDir, "tls"),
  239:     ok = file:write_file(TlsRel ++ ".rel", io_lib:format("~p.",[Rel])),
  240:     code:add_patha(EbinDir),
  241:     ok = systools:make_script(TlsRel),
  242:     ok = systools:script2boot(TlsRel),
  243: 
  244:     %% Start two nodes in embedded mode and make sure they can connect
  245:     %% There used to be a bug here where crypto was not loaded early enough
  246:     %% for the distributed connection to work.
  247:     NodeConfig = [{app_opts, "-boot "++TlsRel++" -mode embedded -pa "++EbinDir++" "} | Config],
  248:     Node1 = peer:random_name(),
  249:     Node2 = peer:random_name(),
  250: 
  251:     NH1 = start_ssl_node([{node_name,Node1}|NodeConfig]),
  252:     %% The second node does `sync_nodes_mandatory` with the first in order for
  253:     %% a connection to be established very early in the boot sequence
  254:     ok = file:write_file(
  255:            filename:join(ReleaseDir,"node2.config"),
  256:            io_lib:format(
  257:              "~p.",[[{kernel,
  258:                       [{sync_nodes_timeout,infinity},
  259:                        {sync_nodes_mandatory,
  260:                         [list_to_atom(Node1++"@"++inet_db:gethostname())]}]}]])),
  261:     NH2 = start_ssl_node([{node_name,Node2}|NodeConfig],
  262:                          " -config " ++ filename:join(ReleaseDir,"node2")),
  263: 
  264:     try
  265:         basic_test(NH1, NH2, Config)
  266:     catch
  267: 	_:Reason ->
  268: 	    stop_ssl_node(NH1),
  269: 	    stop_ssl_node(NH2),
  270: 	    ct:fail(Reason)
  271:     end,
  272:     stop_ssl_node(NH1),
  273:     stop_ssl_node(NH2),
  274:     success(Config).
  275: 
  276: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  277: ktls_encrypt_decrypt() ->
  278:     [{doc,"Test that kTLS encryption offloading works"}].
  279: ktls_encrypt_decrypt(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  280:     ktls_encrypt_decrypt(true);
  281: %%
  282: %%  ktls_encrypt_decrypt(false) is used by init_per_tc(ktls_verify, _)
  283: %%
  284: ktls_encrypt_decrypt(Test) when is_boolean(Test) ->
  285:     %%
  286:     %% We need a connected socket
  287:     {ok, Listen} = gen_tcp:listen(0, [{active, false}]),
  288:     {ok, Port} = inet:port(Listen),
  289:     {ok, Client} =
  290:         gen_tcp:connect({127,0,0,1}, Port, [{active, false}]),
  291:     {ok, Server} = gen_tcp:accept(Listen),
  292:     try
  293:         maybe
  294:             {ok, OS} ?= ssl_test_lib:ktls_os(),
  295:             ok ?= ssl_test_lib:ktls_set_ulp(Client, OS),
  296:             ok ?= ssl_test_lib:ktls_set_cipher(Client, OS, tx, 11),
  297:             case Test of
  298:                 false ->
  299:                     ok;
  300:                 true ->
  301:                     ktls_encrypt_decrypt(Client, Server)
  302:             end
  303:         else
  304:             {error, Reason} ->
  305:                 {skip, Reason}
  306:         end
  307:     after
  308:         _ = gen_tcp:close(Server),
  309:         _ = gen_tcp:close(Client),
  310:         _ = gen_tcp:close(Listen)
  311:     end.
  312: 
  313: ktls_encrypt_decrypt(Client, Server) ->
  314:     %%
  315:     %% Test to transfer encrypted data,
  316:     %% and also to not activate RX encryption and transfer data.
  317:     %%
  318:     Data = "The quick brown fox jumps over a lazy dog 0123456789",
  319:     %%
  320:     %% Send encrypted from Client before Server has activated decryption
  321:     ok = gen_tcp:send(Client, Data),
  322:     receive after 500 -> ok end, % Give time for data to arrive
  323:     %%
  324:     %% Activate Server TX encryption
  325:     {ok, OS} = ssl_test_lib:ktls_os(),
  326:     ok = ssl_test_lib:ktls_set_ulp(Server, OS),
  327:     ok = ssl_test_lib:ktls_set_cipher(Server, OS, tx, 17),
  328:     %% Send encrypted from Server
  329:     ok = gen_tcp:send(Server, Data),
  330:     %% Receive encrypted data without decryption
  331:     case gen_tcp:recv(Client, 0, 1000) of
  332:         {ok, Data} ->
  333:             ct:fail(recv_cleartext_data);
  334:         {ok, RandomData} when length(Data) < length(RandomData) ->
  335:             ?CT_LOG("Received ~p", [RandomData]),
  336:             %% A TLS block should be longer than Data
  337:             ok
  338:     end,
  339:     %% Finally, activate Server decryption
  340:     ok = ssl_test_lib:ktls_set_cipher(Server, OS, rx, 11),
  341:     %% Receive and decrypt the data that was first sent
  342:     {ok, Data} = gen_tcp:recv(Server, 0, 1000),
  343:     ok.
  344: 
  345: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  346: ktls_verify() ->
  347:     [{doc,
  348:       "Test that two nodes can connect via ssl distribution over kTLS"}].
  349: ktls_verify(Config) ->
  350:     KTLSOpts = "-ssl_dist_opt "
  351:         "client_versions tlsv1.3 "
  352:         "server_versions tlsv1.3 "
  353:         "client_ciphers TLS_AES_256_GCM_SHA384 "
  354:         "server_ciphers TLS_AES_256_GCM_SHA384 "
  355:         "client_ktls true "
  356:         "server_ktls true ",
  357:     KTLSConfig = [{tls_verify_opts, KTLSOpts} | Config],
  358:     gen_dist_test(
  359:       fun (NH1, NH2) ->
  360:               basic_test(NH1, NH2, KTLSConfig),
  361:               0 = ktls_count_tls_dist(NH1),
  362:               0 = ktls_count_tls_dist(NH2),
  363:               ok
  364:       end, KTLSConfig).
  365: 
  366: %% Verify that kTLS was activated (whitebox verification);
  367: %% check that a specific supervisor has no child supervisor
  368: %% which indicates that ssl_gen_statem:ktls_handover/1 has succeeded
  369: %%
  370: ktls_count_tls_dist(Node) ->
  371:     Key = supervisors,
  372:     case
  373:         lists:keyfind(
  374:           Key, 1,
  375:           apply_on_ssl_node(
  376:             Node, supervisor, count_children,
  377:             [tls_dist_connection_sup]))
  378:     of
  379:         {Key, N} ->
  380:             N;
  381:         false ->
  382:             0
  383:     end.
  384: 
  385: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  386: %% Test net_kernel:monitor_nodes with nodedown_reason (OTP-17838)
  387: monitor_nodes(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  388:     gen_dist_test(monitor_nodes_test, Config).
  389: 
  390: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  391: payload() ->
  392:     [{doc,"Test that send a lot of data between the ssl distributed nodes"}].
  393: payload(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  394:     gen_dist_test(payload_test, Config).
  395: 
  396: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  397: dist_port_overload() ->
  398:     [{doc, "Test that TLS distribution connections can be accepted concurrently"}].
  399: dist_port_overload(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  400:     (RequiredConcurrency = 2) =< erlang:system_info(schedulers_online)
  401:         orelse
  402:         throw({skip, "Not enough schedulers online"}),
  403:     %%
  404:     %% Start a node, and get the port number it's listening on.
  405:     #node_handle{nodename = NodeName} = NH1 = start_ssl_node(Config),
  406:     [Name, Host] = string:lexemes(atom_to_list(NodeName), "@"),
  407:     {ok, NodesPorts} = apply_on_ssl_node(NH1, fun net_adm:names/0),
  408:     {Name, Port} = lists:keyfind(Name, 1, NodesPorts),
  409:     %% Run RequiredConcurrency connections concurrently.
  410:     %% When TLS handshake is not concurrent,
  411:     %% and with default net_setuptime of 7 seconds,
  412:     %% only one connection per 7 seconds is closed from server side.
  413:     %% With concurrent accept they will be closed in parallel.
  414:     Started = [connect(self(), Host, Port) || _ <- lists:seq(1, RequiredConcurrency)],
  415:     %% give 10 seconds (more than 7, less than 2x7 seconds)
  416:     Responded = barrier(RequiredConcurrency, [], erlang:system_time(millisecond) + 10000),
  417:     %% clean up
  418:     stop_ssl_node(NH1),
  419:     [R ! exit || R <- Responded],
  420:     [exit(P, kill) || P <- Started -- Responded],
  421:     %% Ensure some amount of concurrency was reached.
  422:     (length(Responded) >= RequiredConcurrency) orelse
  423:         ct:fail({actual, length(Responded), expected, RequiredConcurrency}),
  424:     success(Config).
  425: 
  426: barrier(0, Responded, _Until) ->
  427:     Responded;
  428: barrier(RequiredConcurrency, Responded, Until) ->
  429:     Timeout = Until - erlang:system_time(millisecond),
  430:     receive
  431:         {waiting, Pid} ->
  432:             barrier(RequiredConcurrency - 1, [Pid | Responded], Until);
  433:         {error, Error} ->
  434:             ct:fail(Error)
  435:     after
  436:         Timeout -> Responded
  437:     end.
  438: 
  439: connect(Control, Host, Port) ->
  440:     spawn(
  441:         fun () ->
  442:             case gen_tcp:connect(Host, Port, [{active, true}]) of
  443:                 {ok, Sock} ->
  444:                     receive
  445:                         {tcp_closed, Sock} ->
  446:                             Control ! {waiting, self()};
  447:                         exit ->
  448:                             gen_tcp:close(Sock)
  449:                     end;
  450:                 Error ->
  451:                     Control ! {error, Error}
  452:             end
  453:         end).
  454: 
  455: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  456: plain_options() ->
  457:     [{doc,"Test specifying tls options not related to certificate verification"}].
  458: plain_options(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  459:     TLSOpts = "-ssl_dist_opt server_secure_renegotiate true "
  460: 	"client_secure_renegotiate true "
  461: 	"server_hibernate_after 500 client_hibernate_after 500",
  462:     gen_dist_test(plain_options_test, [{tls_only_basic_opts, TLSOpts} | Config]).
  463: 
  464: 
  465: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  466: plain_verify_options() ->
  467:     [{doc,"Test specifying tls options including certificate verification options"}].
  468: plain_verify_options(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  469:     TLSOpts = "-ssl_dist_opt "
  470:         "server_secure_renegotiate true "
  471:         "client_secure_renegotiate true "
  472:         "server_hibernate_after 500 "
  473:         "client_hibernate_after 500 "
  474:         "server_reuse_sessions true "
  475:         "client_reuse_sessions true "
  476:         "server_depth 1 "
  477:         "client_depth 1 ",
  478:     gen_dist_test(plain_verify_options_test, [{tls_verify_opts, TLSOpts} | Config]).
  479: 
  480: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  481: nodelay_option() ->
  482:     [{doc,"Test specifying dist_nodelay option"}].
  483: nodelay_option(Config) ->
  484:     try
  485: 	%% The default is 'true', so try setting it to 'false'.
  486: 	application:set_env(kernel, dist_nodelay, false),
  487: 	basic(Config)
  488:     after
  489: 	application:unset_env(kernel, dist_nodelay)
  490:     end.
  491: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  492: 
  493: listen_port_options() ->
  494:     [{doc, "Test specifying listening ports"}].
  495: listen_port_options(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  496:     %% Set up the probably most supported scenario
  497:     %% for {reuseaddr,true}, i.e, the listening socket
  498:     %% is closed, but an accepted server side socket
  499:     %% blocks the server port, unless {reuseaddr,true}
  500:     %% is used.
  501:     %%
  502:     %% Set up a server socket and close the listening socket
  503:     {ok, L}    = gen_tcp:listen(0, [{reuseaddr,true}]),
  504:     {ok, Port} = inet:port(L),
  505:     {ok, C}    = gen_tcp:connect({127,0,0,1}, Port, []),
  506:     {ok, S}    = gen_tcp:accept(L),
  507:     ok         = gen_tcp:close(L),
  508:     ?CT_LOG("Port: ~w", [Port]),
  509:     %%
  510:     %% Start a node on the server port, {reuseaddr,true}
  511:     %% is used per default on the listening socket
  512:     %% since it is a server - see inet_tcp_dist:gen_listen/3
  513:     PortOpts =
  514:         "-kernel"
  515:         " inet_dist_listen_min " ++ integer_to_list(Port) ++
  516:         " inet_dist_listen_max " ++ integer_to_list(Port),
  517:     %% basic_test/3 connects NH1 -> NH2 so it is NH2 that should
  518:     %% act as server to make use of PortOpts
  519:     NH1 = start_ssl_node(Config),
  520:     NH2 = start_ssl_node(Config, PortOpts),
  521:     try
  522:         basic_test(NH1, NH2, Config),
  523:         Node2 = NH2#node_handle.nodename,
  524:         {ok,NodeInfo2} =
  525:             apply_on_ssl_node(NH1, net_kernel, node_info, [Node2]),
  526:         {address,#net_address{address = {_,Port}, protocol = tls}} =
  527:             lists:keyfind(address, 1, NodeInfo2),
  528:         ok
  529:     after
  530:         gen_tcp:close(C),
  531:         gen_tcp:close(S),
  532:         stop_ssl_node(NH1),
  533:         stop_ssl_node(NH2)
  534:     end.
  535: 
  536: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  537: listen_options() ->
  538:     [{doc, "Test inet_dist_listen_options"}].
  539: listen_options(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  540:     try_setting_priority(fun do_listen_options/2, Config).
  541:

  543: connect_options() ->

  546:     try_setting_priority(fun do_connect_options/2, Config).
  547: 
  548: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  549: net_ticker_spawn_options() ->
  550:     [{doc, "Test net_ticker_spawn_options"}].
  551: net_ticker_spawn_options(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  552:     FullsweepString = maybe_quote_tuple_list("[{fullsweep_after,0}]"),
  553:     Options = "-kernel net_ticker_spawn_options "++FullsweepString,
  554:     gen_dist_test(net_ticker_spawn_options_test, [{tls_only_basic_opts, Options} | Config]).
  555: 
  556: 
  557: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  558: use_interface() ->
  559:     [{doc, "Test inet_dist_use_interface"}].
  560: use_interface(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  561:     %% Force the node to listen only on the loopback interface.
  562:     IpString = localhost_ipstr(inet_ver()),
  563:     Options = "-kernel inet_dist_use_interface " ++ IpString,
  564: 
  565:     %% Start a node, and get the port number it's listening on.
  566:     NH1 = start_ssl_node([{tls_verify_opts, Options} | Config]),
  567:   
  568:     try
  569: 	Node1 = NH1#node_handle.nodename,
  570: 	Name = lists:takewhile(fun(C) -> C =/= $@ end, atom_to_list(Node1)),
  571: 	{ok, NodesPorts} = apply_on_ssl_node(NH1, fun net_adm:names/0),
  572: 	{Name, Port} = lists:keyfind(Name, 1, NodesPorts),
  573: 	
  574: 	%% Now find the socket listening on that port, and check its sockname.
  575: 	Sockets = apply_on_ssl_node(
  576: 		    NH1,
  577: 		    fun() ->
  578: 			    [inet:sockname(P) ||
  579: 				P <- inet_ports(),
  580: 				{ok, Port} =:= (catch inet:port(P))]
  581: 		    end),
  582: 	%% And check that it's actually listening on localhost.
  583:         IP = localhost_ip(inet_ver()),
  584:         [{ok,{IP,Port}}] = Sockets
  585:     catch 
  586: 	_:Reason ->
  587: 	    stop_ssl_node(NH1),
  588: 	    ct:fail(Reason)
  589:     end,
  590:     stop_ssl_node(NH1),
  591:     success(Config).
  592: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  593: verify_fun_fail() ->
  594:     [{doc,"Test specifying verify_fun with a function that always fails"}].
  595: verify_fun_fail(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  596:       AddTLSVerifyOpts = "-ssl_dist_opt "
  597:         "server_verify_fun "
  598: 	"\"{ssl_dist_SUITE,verify_fail_always,{}}\" "
  599:         "client_verify_fun "
  600: 	"\"{ssl_dist_SUITE,verify_fail_always,{}}\" ",
  601:     gen_dist_test(verify_fun_fail_test, [{tls_verify_opts, AddTLSVerifyOpts} | Config]).
  602: 
  603: 
  604: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  605: verify_fun_pass() ->
  606:     [{doc,"Test specifying verify_fun with a function that always succeeds"}].
  607: verify_fun_pass(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  608:     AddTLSVerifyOpts = "-ssl_dist_opt "
  609:         "server_verify_fun "
  610: 	"\"{ssl_dist_SUITE,verify_pass_always,{}}\" "
  611:         "client_verify_fun "
  612: 	"\"{ssl_dist_SUITE,verify_pass_always,{}}\" ",
  613:     gen_dist_test(verify_fun_pass_test, [{tls_verify_opts, AddTLSVerifyOpts} | Config]).
  614: 
  615: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  616: epmd_module() ->
  617:     [{doc,"Test that custom epmd_modules work"}].
  618: epmd_module(Config0) when is_list(Config0) ->
  619:     Config = [{hostname, "dummy"} | Config0],
  620:     NH1 = start_ssl_node(Config, "-epmd_module " ++ atom_to_list(?MODULE)),
  621:     NH2 = start_ssl_node(Config, "-epmd_module " ++ atom_to_list(?MODULE)),
  622: 
  623:     {ok, Port1} = apply_on_ssl_node(NH1, fun() -> application:get_env(kernel, dist_listen_port) end),
  624:     {ok, Port2} = apply_on_ssl_node(NH2, fun() -> application:get_env(kernel, dist_listen_port) end),
  625:     apply_on_ssl_node(NH1, fun() -> application:set_env(kernel, dist_connect_port, Port2) end),
  626:     apply_on_ssl_node(NH2, fun() -> application:set_env(kernel, dist_connect_port, Port1) end),
  627: 
  628:     try
  629:         basic_test(NH1, NH2, Config)
  630:     catch
  631: 	_:Reason ->
  632: 	    stop_ssl_node(NH1),
  633: 	    stop_ssl_node(NH2),
  634: 	    ct:fail(Reason)
  635:     end,
  636:     stop_ssl_node(NH1),
  637:     stop_ssl_node(NH2),	
  638:     success(Config).
  639: 
  640: start_link() ->
  641:     ignore.
  642: 
  643: register_node(Name, Port) ->
  644:     register_node(Name, Port, inet_tcp).
  645: register_node(_Name, Port, _Driver) ->
  646:     %% Save the port number we're listening on.
  647:     application:set_env(kernel, dist_listen_port, Port),
  648:     Creation = rand:uniform(3),
  649:     {ok, Creation}.
  650: 
  651: port_please(_Name, _Ip) ->
  652:     {ok, Port} = application:get_env(kernel, dist_connect_port),
  653:     {port, Port, 5}.
  654: 
  655: address_please(_Name, "dummy", AddressFamily) ->
  656:     %% Use localhost.
  657:     {ok,Host} = inet:gethostname(),
  658:     inet:getaddr(Host, AddressFamily);
  659: address_please(_, _, _) ->
  660:     {error, nxdomain}.
  661: 
  662: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  663: %%% Internal functions -----------------------------------------------
  664: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  665: gen_dist_test(Test, Config) ->
  666:     NH1 = start_ssl_node(Config),
  667:     NH2 = start_ssl_node(Config),
  668:     try
  669:         if
  670:             is_atom(Test) ->
  671:                 ?MODULE:Test(NH1, NH2, Config);
  672:             is_function(Test, 2) ->
  673:                 Test(NH1, NH2)
  674:         end
  675:     catch
  676: 	Class:Reason:Stacktrace ->
  677: 	    ct:fail({Class,Reason,Stacktrace})
  678:     after
  679:         stop_ssl_node(NH1),
  680:         stop_ssl_node(NH2)
  681:     end,
  682:     success(Config).
  683: 
  684: %% ssl_node side api
  685: %%
  686: 
  687: try_setting_priority(TestFun, Config) ->
  688:     Prio = 1,
  689:     case gen_udp:open(0, [{priority,Prio}]) of
  690: 	{ok,Socket} ->
  691: 	    case inet:getopts(Socket, [priority]) of
  692: 		{ok,[{priority,Prio}]} ->
  693: 		    ok = gen_udp:close(Socket),
  694: 		    TestFun(Prio, Config);
  695: 		_ ->
  696: 		    ok = gen_udp:close(Socket),
  697: 		    {skip,
  698: 		     "Can not set priority "++integer_to_list(Prio)++
  699: 			 " on socket"}
  700: 	    end;
  701: 	{error,_} ->
  702: 	    {skip, "Can not set priority on socket"}
  703:     end.
  704: 
  705: basic_test(NH1, NH2, _) ->
  706:     Node1 = NH1#node_handle.nodename,
  707:     Node2 = NH2#node_handle.nodename,
  708:     pong = apply_on_ssl_node(NH1, fun () -> net_adm:ping(Node2) end),
  709:     [Node2] = apply_on_ssl_node(NH1, fun () -> nodes() end),
  710:     [Node1] = apply_on_ssl_node(NH2, fun () -> nodes() end),
  711: 
  712:     verify_tls(NH1, NH2),
  713: 
  714:     %% The test_server node has the same cookie as the ssl nodes
  715:     %% but it should not be able to communicate with the ssl nodes
  716:     %% via the erlang distribution.
  717:     pang = net_adm:ping(Node1),
  718:     pang = net_adm:ping(Node2),
  719: 
  720:     %% SSL nodes should not be able to communicate with the test_server node
  721:     %% either (and ping should return eventually).
  722:     TestServer = node(),
  723:     pang = apply_on_ssl_node(NH1, fun () -> net_adm:ping(TestServer) end),
  724:     pang = apply_on_ssl_node(NH2, fun () -> net_adm:ping(TestServer) end),
  725: 
  726:     %%
  727:     %% Check that we are able to communicate over the erlang
  728:     %% distribution between the ssl nodes.
  729:     %%
  730:     Ref = make_ref(),
  731:     spawn(fun () ->
  732: 		  apply_on_ssl_node(
  733: 		    NH1,
  734: 		    fun () ->
  735: 			    tstsrvr_format(
  736:                               "Hi from ~p!~n", [node()]),
  737: 			    send_to_tstcntrl(
  738:                               {Ref, self()}),
  739: 			    receive
  740: 				{From, ping} ->
  741: 				    tstsrvr_format(
  742:                                       "Received ping ~p!~n", [node()]),
  743: 				    From ! {self(), pong}
  744: 			    end
  745: 		    end)
  746: 	  end),
  747:      receive
  748: 	 {Ref, SslPid} ->
  749: 	     ok = apply_on_ssl_node(
  750: 		    NH2,
  751: 		    fun () ->
  752: 			    tstsrvr_format(
  753:                               "Hi from ~p!~n", [node()]),
  754: 			    SslPid ! {self(), ping},
  755: 			    receive
  756: 				{SslPid, pong} ->
  757: 				    ok
  758: 			    end
  759: 		    end)
  760:      end.
  761: 
  762: monitor_nodes_test(NH1, NH2, _) ->
  763:     Node2 = NH2#node_handle.nodename,
  764: 
  765:     Ref = make_ref(),
  766:     MonitorNodesFun =
  767:         fun() ->
  768:                 tstsrvr_format("Hi from ~p!~n", [node()]),
  769:                 ok = net_kernel:monitor_nodes(true, [nodedown_reason]),
  770:                 send_to_tstcntrl({self(), ready, Ref}),
  771:                 NodeUp = receive_any(),
  772:                 send_to_tstcntrl({self(), got, NodeUp}),
  773:                 NodeDown = receive_any(),
  774:                 send_to_tstcntrl({self(), got, NodeDown}),
  775:                 ok = net_kernel:monitor_nodes(false, [nodedown_reason])
  776:         end,
  777:     spawn_link(fun () ->
  778:                        ok = apply_on_ssl_node(NH1, MonitorNodesFun)
  779:                end),
  780:     {SslPid, ready, Ref} = receive_any(),
  781: 
  782:     %% Setup connection and expect 'nodeup'
  783:     pong = apply_on_ssl_node(NH1, fun () -> net_adm:ping(Node2) end),
  784:     {SslPid, got, {nodeup, Node2, []}} = receive_any(),
  785: 
  786:     %% Disconnect and expect 'nodedown' with correct reason
  787:     true = apply_on_ssl_node(NH1, fun () ->
  788:                                           net_kernel:disconnect(Node2)
  789:                                   end),
  790:     {SslPid, got, {nodedown, Node2, [{nodedown_reason, disconnect}]}} = receive_any(),
  791:     ok.
  792: 
  793: 
  794: receive_any() ->
  795:     receive M -> M end.
  796: 
  797: payload_test(NH1, NH2, _) ->
  798:     Node1 = NH1#node_handle.nodename,
  799:     Node2 = NH2#node_handle.nodename,
  800: 
  801:     pong = apply_on_ssl_node(NH1, fun () -> net_adm:ping(Node2) end),
  802: 
  803:     verify_tls(NH1, NH2),
  804: 
  805:     [Node2] = apply_on_ssl_node(NH1, fun () -> nodes() end),
  806:     [Node1] = apply_on_ssl_node(NH2, fun () -> nodes() end),
  807: 
  808:     Ref = make_ref(),
  809:     spawn(fun () ->
  810: 		  apply_on_ssl_node(
  811: 		    NH1,
  812: 		    fun () ->
  813: 			    send_to_tstcntrl(
  814:                               {Ref, self()}),
  815: 			    receive
  816: 				{From, Msg} ->
  817: 				    From ! {self(), Msg}
  818: 			    end
  819: 		    end)
  820: 	  end),
  821:      receive
  822: 	 {Ref, SslPid} ->
  823: 	     ok = apply_on_ssl_node(
  824: 		    NH2,
  825: 		    fun () ->
  826: 			    Msg = crypto:strong_rand_bytes(100000),
  827: 			    SslPid ! {self(), Msg},
  828: 			    receive
  829: 				{SslPid, Msg} ->
  830: 				    ok
  831: 			    end
  832: 		    end)
  833:      end.
  834: 
  835: plain_options_test(NH1, NH2, _) ->
  836:     Node1 = NH1#node_handle.nodename,
  837:     Node2 = NH2#node_handle.nodename,
  838: 
  839:     pong = apply_on_ssl_node(NH1, fun () -> net_adm:ping(Node2) end),
  840: 
  841:     verify_tls(NH1, NH2),
  842: 
  843:     [Node2] = apply_on_ssl_node(NH1, fun () -> nodes() end),
  844:     [Node1] = apply_on_ssl_node(NH2, fun () -> nodes() end).
  845: 
  846: plain_verify_options_test(NH1, NH2, _) ->
  847:     Node1 = NH1#node_handle.nodename,
  848:     Node2 = NH2#node_handle.nodename,
  849: 
  850:     pong = apply_on_ssl_node(NH1, fun () -> net_adm:ping(Node2) end),
  851: 
  852:     verify_tls(NH1, NH2),
  853: 
  854:     [Node2] = apply_on_ssl_node(NH1, fun () -> nodes() end),
  855:     [Node1] = apply_on_ssl_node(NH2, fun () -> nodes() end).
  856: 
  857: do_listen_options(Prio, Config) ->
  858:     PriorityString =
  859:         maybe_quote_tuple_list("[{priority,"++integer_to_list(Prio)++"}]"),
  860:     Options = "-kernel inet_dist_listen_options " ++ PriorityString,
  861:     gen_dist_test(listen_options_test, [{prio, Prio}, {tls_only_basic_opts, Options} | Config]).
  862: 
  863: listen_options_test(NH1, NH2, Config) ->
  864:     Prio = proplists:get_value(prio, Config),
  865:     Node2 = NH2#node_handle.nodename,
  866:     pong = apply_on_ssl_node(NH1, fun () -> net_adm:ping(Node2) end),
  867: 
  868:     PrioritiesNode1 =
  869: 	apply_on_ssl_node(NH1, fun get_socket_priorities/0),
  870:     PrioritiesNode2 =
  871: 	apply_on_ssl_node(NH2, fun get_socket_priorities/0),
  872: 
  873:     Elevated1 = [P || P <- PrioritiesNode1, P =:= Prio],
  874:     ?CT_LOG("Elevated1: ~p~n", [Elevated1]),
  875:     Elevated2 = [P || P <- PrioritiesNode2, P =:= Prio],
  876:     ?CT_LOG("Elevated2: ~p~n", [Elevated2]),
  877:     [_|_] = Elevated1,
  878:     [_|_] = Elevated2.
  879: 
  880: do_connect_options(Prio, Config) ->
  881:     PriorityString =
  882:         maybe_quote_tuple_list("[{priority,"++integer_to_list(Prio)++"}]"),
  883:     Options = "-kernel inet_dist_connect_options " ++ PriorityString,
  884:     gen_dist_test(connect_options_test,
  885: 		  [{prio, Prio}, {tls_only_basic_opts, Options} | Config]).
  886: 
  887: connect_options_test(NH1, NH2, Config) ->
  888:     Prio = proplists:get_value(prio, Config),
  889:     Node2 = NH2#node_handle.nodename,
  890: 
  891:     pong = apply_on_ssl_node(NH1, fun () -> net_adm:ping(Node2) end),
  892: 
  893:     PrioritiesNode1 =
  894: 	apply_on_ssl_node(NH1, fun get_socket_priorities/0),
  895:     PrioritiesNode2 =
  896: 	apply_on_ssl_node(NH2, fun get_socket_priorities/0),
  897: 
  898:     Elevated1 = [P || P <- PrioritiesNode1, P =:= Prio],
  899:     ?CT_LOG("Elevated1: ~p~n", [Elevated1]),
  900:     Elevated2 = [P || P <- PrioritiesNode2, P =:= Prio],
  901:     ?CT_LOG("Elevated2: ~p~n", [Elevated2]),
  902:     %% Node 1 will have a socket with elevated priority.
  903:     [_|_] = Elevated1,
  904:     %% Node 2 will not, since it only applies to outbound connections.
  905:     [] = Elevated2.
  906: 
  907: net_ticker_spawn_options_test(NH1, NH2, _Config) ->
  908:     Node1 = NH1#node_handle.nodename,
  909:     Node2 = NH2#node_handle.nodename,
  910: 
  911:     pong = apply_on_ssl_node(NH1, fun () -> net_adm:ping(Node2) end),
  912: 
  913:     FullsweepOptionNode1 =
  914:         apply_on_ssl_node(NH1, fun () -> get_dist_util_fullsweep_option(Node2) end),
  915:     FullsweepOptionNode2 =
  916:         apply_on_ssl_node(NH2, fun () -> get_dist_util_fullsweep_option(Node1) end),
  917: 
  918:     ?CT_LOG("FullsweepOptionNode1: ~p~n", [FullsweepOptionNode1]),
  919:     ?CT_LOG("FullsweepOptionNode2: ~p~n", [FullsweepOptionNode2]),
  920: 
  921:     0 = FullsweepOptionNode1,
  922:     0 = FullsweepOptionNode2.
  923: 
  924: 
  925: verify_fun_fail_test(NH1, NH2, _) ->
  926:     Node2 = NH2#node_handle.nodename,
  927: 
  928:     pang = apply_on_ssl_node(NH1, fun () -> net_adm:ping(Node2) end),
  929: 
  930:     [] = apply_on_ssl_node(NH1, fun () -> nodes() end),
  931:     [] = apply_on_ssl_node(NH2, fun () -> nodes() end),
  932: 
  933:     %% Check that the function ran on the client node.
  934:     [{verify_fail_always_ran, true}] =
  935:         apply_on_ssl_node(NH1, fun () -> ets:tab2list(verify_fun_ran) end),
  936:     %% On the server node, it wouldn't run, because the server didn't
  937:     %% request a certificate from the client.
  938:     undefined =
  939:         apply_on_ssl_node(NH2, fun () -> ets:info(verify_fun_ran) end).
  940: 
  941: verify_fun_pass_test(NH1, NH2, _) ->
  942:     Node1 = NH1#node_handle.nodename,
  943:     Node2 = NH2#node_handle.nodename,
  944: 
  945:     pong = apply_on_ssl_node(NH1, fun () -> net_adm:ping(Node2) end),
  946: 
  947:     [Node2] = apply_on_ssl_node(NH1, fun () -> nodes() end),
  948:     [Node1] = apply_on_ssl_node(NH2, fun () -> nodes() end),
  949: 
  950:     %% Check that the function ran on the client node.
  951:     [{verify_pass_always_ran, true}] =
  952:         apply_on_ssl_node(NH1, fun () -> ets:tab2list(verify_fun_ran) end),
  953:     %% Check that it ran on the server node as well.  The server
  954:     %% requested and verified the client's certificate because we
  955:     %% passed fail_if_no_peer_cert.
  956:     [{verify_pass_always_ran, true}] =
  957:         apply_on_ssl_node(NH2, fun () -> ets:tab2list(verify_fun_ran) end).
  958: 
  959: 
  960: get_socket_priorities() ->
  961:     [Priority ||
  962: 	{ok,[{priority,Priority}]} <-
  963: 	    [inet:getopts(Port, [priority]) || Port <- inet_ports()]].
  964: 
  965: get_dist_util_fullsweep_option(Node) ->
  966:     SenderPid = proplists:get_value(Node, erlang:system_info(dist_ctrl)),
  967:     {links, Links1} = erlang:process_info(SenderPid, links),
  968:     {links, Links2} = erlang:process_info(whereis(net_kernel), links),
  969:     [DistUtilPid] = [X || X <- Links1, Y <- Links2, X =:= Y],
  970:     {garbage_collection, GCOpts} = erlang:process_info(DistUtilPid, garbage_collection),
  971:     proplists:get_value(fullsweep_after, GCOpts).
  972: 
  973: inet_ports() ->
  974:      [Port || Port <- erlang:ports(),
  975:               element(2, erlang:port_info(Port, name)) =:= "tcp_inet"].
  976: 
  977: start_ssl_node(Config) ->
  978:     start_ssl_node(Config, "").
  979: 
  980: start_ssl_node(Config, XArgs) ->
  981:     Name = mk_node_name(Config),
  982:     App = proplists:get_value(app_opts, Config),
  983:     SSLOpts = setup_tls_opts(Config),
  984:     start_ssl_node_name(
  985:       Name, App ++ " " ++ SSLOpts ++ " " ++ XArgs).
  986: 
  987: 
  988: mk_node_name(Config) ->
  989:     case proplists:get_value(node_name, Config) of
  990:         undefined ->
  991:             N = erlang:unique_integer([positive]),
  992:             Case = proplists:get_value(testcase, Config),
  993:             Hostname =
  994:                 case proplists:get_value(hostname, Config) of
  995:                     undefined -> "";
  996:                     Host -> "@" ++ Host
  997:                 end,
  998:             atom_to_list(?MODULE)
  999:                 ++ "_"
 1000:                 ++ atom_to_list(Case)
 1001:                 ++ "_"
 1002:                 ++ integer_to_list(N) ++ Hostname;
 1003:         Name ->
 1004:             Name
 1005:     end.
 1006: 
 1007: setup_certs(Config) ->
 1008:     {ok,Host} = inet:gethostname(),
 1009:     Extensions =
 1010:         {extensions,
 1011:          [#'Extension'{
 1012:              extnID = ?'id-ce-subjectAltName',
 1013:              extnValue = [{dNSName, Host}],
 1014:              critical = false}]},
 1015:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1016:     DerConfig =
 1017:         public_key:pkix_test_data(
 1018:           #{server_chain =>
 1019:                 #{root => [rsa_root_key(1), {digest,sha256}],
 1020:                   intermediates => [rsa_intermediate_conf(2)],
 1021:                   peer => [rsa_peer_key(3),  {digest, sha256}, Extensions]},
 1022:             client_chain =>
 1023:                 #{root => [rsa_root_key(1),  {digest, sha256}],
 1024:                   intermediates => [rsa_intermediate_conf(5)],
 1025:                   peer => [rsa_peer_key(6), {digest, sha256}, Extensions]}}),
 1026:     ClientBase = filename:join([PrivDir, "rsa"]),
 1027:     ServerBase =  filename:join([PrivDir, "rsa"]),
 1028:     _  = x509_test:gen_pem_config_files(DerConfig, ClientBase, ServerBase).
 1029: 
 1030: setup_tls_opts(Config) ->
 1031:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1032:     SC = filename:join([PrivDir, "rsa_server_cert.pem"]),
 1033:     SK = filename:join([PrivDir, "rsa_server_key.pem"]),
 1034:     SCA = filename:join([PrivDir, "rsa_server_cacerts.pem"]),
 1035:     CC = filename:join([PrivDir, "rsa_client_cert.pem"]),
 1036:     CK = filename:join([PrivDir, "rsa_client_key.pem"]),
 1037:     CCA = filename:join([PrivDir, "rsa_client_cacerts.pem"]),
 1038: 
 1039:     case proplists:get_value(tls_only_basic_opts, Config, []) of
 1040:         [_|_] = BasicOpts -> %% No verify but server still need to have cert
 1041:             "-proto_dist inet_tls " ++ "-ssl_dist_opt server_certfile " ++ SC ++ " "
 1042:                 ++ "-ssl_dist_opt server_keyfile " ++ SK ++ " " ++ " -ssl_dist_opt client_verify verify_none " ++ BasicOpts;
 1043:         [] -> %% Verify
 1044:             TlsVerifyOpts = proplists:get_value(tls_verify_opts, Config, []),
 1045:              case TlsVerifyOpts of
 1046:                  [_|_] ->
 1047:                      "-proto_dist inet_tls "
 1048:                          ++ "-ssl_dist_opt server_certfile " ++ SC ++ " "
 1049:                          ++ "-ssl_dist_opt server_keyfile " ++ SK ++ " "
 1050:                          ++ "-ssl_dist_opt server_cacertfile " ++ SCA ++ " "
 1051:                          ++ "-ssl_dist_opt server_verify verify_peer "
 1052:                          ++ "-ssl_dist_opt server_fail_if_no_peer_cert true "
 1053:                          ++ "-ssl_dist_opt client_certfile " ++ CC ++ " "
 1054:                          ++ "-ssl_dist_opt client_keyfile " ++ CK ++ " "
 1055:                          ++ "-ssl_dist_opt client_cacertfile " ++ CCA ++ " "
 1056:                          ++ "-ssl_dist_opt client_verify verify_peer "
 1057:                          ++  TlsVerifyOpts;
 1058:                  _ ->  %% No verify, no extra opts
 1059:                      "-proto_dist inet_tls " ++ "-ssl_dist_opt server_certfile " ++ SC ++ " "
 1060:                          ++ "-ssl_dist_opt server_keyfile " ++ SK ++ " " ++ "-ssl_dist_opt client_verify verify_none "
 1061:              end
 1062:     end.
 1063: 
 1064: %%
 1065: %% Start scripts etc...
 1066: %%
 1067: 
 1068: add_ssl_opts_config(Config) ->
 1069:     %%
 1070:     %% Start with boot scripts if on an installed system; otherwise,
 1071:     %% just point out ssl ebin with -pa.
 1072:     %%
 1073:     try
 1074: 	Dir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1075: 	LibDir = code:lib_dir(),
 1076: 	Apps = application:which_applications(),
 1077: 	{value, {stdlib, _, STDL_VSN}} = lists:keysearch(stdlib, 1, Apps),
 1078: 	{value, {kernel, _, KRNL_VSN}} = lists:keysearch(kernel, 1, Apps),
 1079: 	StdlDir = filename:join([LibDir, "stdlib-" ++ STDL_VSN]),
 1080: 	KrnlDir = filename:join([LibDir, "kernel-" ++ KRNL_VSN]),
 1081: 	{ok, _} = file:read_file_info(StdlDir),
 1082: 	{ok, _} = file:read_file_info(KrnlDir),
 1083: 	SSL_VSN = get_app_vsn(ssl),
 1084: 	VSN_CRYPTO = get_app_vsn(crypto),
 1085: 	VSN_ASN1 = get_app_vsn(asn1),
 1086: 	VSN_PKEY = get_app_vsn(public_key),
 1087: 
 1088: 	SslDir = filename:join([LibDir, "ssl-" ++ SSL_VSN]),
 1089: 	{ok, _} = file:read_file_info(SslDir),
 1090: 	%% We are using an installed otp system, create the boot script.
 1091: 	Script = filename:join(Dir, atom_to_list(?MODULE)),
 1092: 	{ok, RelFile} = file:open(Script ++ ".rel", [write]),
 1093:         io:format(RelFile,
 1094: 		  "{release, ~n"
 1095: 		  " {\"SSL distribution test release\", \"~s\"},~n"
 1096: 		  " {erts, \"~s\"},~n"
 1097: 		  " [{kernel, \"~s\"},~n"
 1098: 		  "  {stdlib, \"~s\"},~n"
 1099: 		  "  {crypto, \"~s\"},~n"
 1100: 		  "  {asn1, \"~s\"},~n"
 1101: 		  "  {public_key, \"~s\"},~n"
 1102: 		  "  {ssl, \"~s\"}]}.~n",
 1103: 		  [case catch erlang:system_info(otp_release) of
 1104: 		       {'EXIT', _} -> "R11B";
 1105: 		       Rel -> Rel
 1106: 		   end,
 1107: 		   erlang:system_info(version),
 1108: 		   KRNL_VSN,
 1109: 		   STDL_VSN,
 1110: 		   VSN_CRYPTO,
 1111:                    VSN_ASN1,
 1112: 		   VSN_PKEY,
 1113: 		   SSL_VSN]),
 1114: 	ok = file:close(RelFile),
 1115:         ?CT_LOG("Bootscript: ~p", [Script]),
 1116: 	case systools:make_script(Script, []) of
 1117:             ok ->
 1118:                 ok;
 1119:             NotOk ->
 1120:                 ?CT_PAL("Bootscript problem: ~p", [NotOk]),
 1121:                 erlang:error(NotOk)
 1122:         end,
 1123: 	[{app_opts, "-boot " ++ Script} | Config]
 1124:     catch
 1125: 	Class : Reason : Stacktrace ->
 1126:             ?CT_LOG("Exception while generating bootscript:~n~p",
 1127:                    [{Class, Reason, Stacktrace}]),
 1128: 	    [{app_opts, "-pa \"" ++ filename:dirname(code:which(ssl))++"\""}
 1129: 	     | add_comment_config(
 1130: 		 "Bootscript wasn't used since the test wasn't run on an "
 1131: 		 "installed OTP system.",
 1132: 		 Config)]
 1133:     end.
 1134: 
 1135: add_comment_config(Comment, []) ->
 1136:     [{comment, Comment}];
 1137: add_comment_config(Comment, [{comment, OldComment} | Cs]) ->
 1138:     [{comment, Comment ++ " " ++ OldComment} | Cs];
 1139: add_comment_config(Comment, [C|Cs]) ->
 1140:     [C|add_comment_config(Comment, Cs)].
 1141: 
 1142: 
 1143: success(Config) ->
 1144:     case lists:keysearch(comment, 1, Config) of
 1145: 	{value, {comment, _} = Res} -> Res;
 1146: 	_ -> ok
 1147:     end.
 1148: 
 1149: get_app_vsn(erts) ->
 1150:     erlang:system_info(version);
 1151: get_app_vsn(App) ->
 1152:     application:load(App),
 1153:     {ok, AppKeys} = application:get_all_key(App),
 1154:     proplists:get_value(vsn, AppKeys).
 1155: 
 1156: verify_fail_always(_Certificate, _Event, _State) ->
 1157:     %% Create an ETS table, to record the fact that the verify function ran.
 1158:     %% Spawn a new process, to avoid the ETS table disappearing.
 1159:     Parent = self(),
 1160:     spawn(
 1161:       fun() ->
 1162:               catch ets:delete(verify_fun_ran),
 1163: 	      ets:new(verify_fun_ran, [public, named_table]),
 1164: 	      ets:insert(verify_fun_ran, {verify_fail_always_ran, true}),
 1165: 	      Parent ! go_ahead,
 1166: 	      timer:sleep(infinity)
 1167:       end),
 1168:     receive go_ahead -> ok end,
 1169:     {fail, bad_certificate}.
 1170: 
 1171: verify_pass_always(_Certificate, _Event, State) ->
 1172:     %% Create an ETS table, to record the fact that the verify function ran.
 1173:     %% Spawn a new process, to avoid the ETS table disappearing.
 1174:     Parent = self(),
 1175:     spawn(
 1176:       fun() ->
 1177:               catch ets:delete(verify_fun_ran),
 1178: 	      ets:new(verify_fun_ran, [public, named_table]),
 1179: 	      ets:insert(verify_fun_ran, {verify_pass_always_ran, true}),
 1180: 	      Parent ! go_ahead,
 1181: 	      timer:sleep(infinity)
 1182:       end),
 1183:     receive go_ahead -> ok end,
 1184:     {valid, State}.
 1185: 
 1186: verify_tls(NH1, NH2) ->
 1187:     %% Verify that distribution protocol between nodes is TLS
 1188:     Node1 = NH1#node_handle.nodename,
 1189:     Node2 = NH2#node_handle.nodename,
 1190:     {ok,NodeInfo2} = apply_on_ssl_node(NH1, net_kernel, node_info, [Node2]),
 1191:     {ok,NodeInfo1} = apply_on_ssl_node(NH2, net_kernel, node_info, [Node1]),
 1192:     {address,#net_address{protocol = tls}} =
 1193:         lists:keyfind(address, 1, NodeInfo1),
 1194:     {address,#net_address{protocol = tls}} =
 1195:         lists:keyfind(address, 1, NodeInfo2),
 1196:     ok.
 1197: 
 1198: localhost_ip(InetVer) ->
 1199:     {ok, Addr} = inet:getaddr(net_adm:localhost(), InetVer),
 1200:     Addr.
 1201: 
 1202: localhost_ipstr(InetVer) ->
 1203:     {ok, Addr} = inet:getaddr(net_adm:localhost(), InetVer),
 1204:     Str = case InetVer of
 1205:               inet ->
 1206:                   io_lib:format("{~p,~p,~p,~p}", erlang:tuple_to_list(Addr));
 1207:               inet6 ->
 1208:                   io_lib:format("{~p,~p,~p,~p,~p,~p,~p,~p}", erlang:tuple_to_list(Addr))
 1209:           end,
 1210:     Qouted = case os:type() of
 1211:                  {win32, _} -> Str;
 1212:                  _ -> [$',Str,$']
 1213:              end,
 1214:     lists:flatten(Qouted).
 1215: 
 1216: inet_ver() ->
 1217:     inet.
 1218: 
 1219: rsa_root_key(N) ->
 1220:     %% As rsa keygen is not guaranteed to be fast
 1221:     {key, ssl_test_lib:hardcode_rsa_key(N)}.
 1222: 
 1223: rsa_peer_key(N) ->
 1224:     %% As rsa keygen is not guaranteed to be fast
 1225:     {key, ssl_test_lib:hardcode_rsa_key(N)}.
 1226: 
 1227: rsa_intermediate_conf(N) ->
 1228:     [{key, ssl_test_lib:hardcode_rsa_key(N)}, {digest, sha256}].
 1229: 
 1230: 
 1231: maybe_quote_tuple_list(String) ->
 1232:     case os:cmd("echo [{a,1}]") of
 1233:         "[{a,1}]"++_ ->
 1234:             String;
 1235:         _ ->
 1236:             %% Some shells need quoting of [{}]
 1237:             "'"++String++"'"
 1238:     end.
